request_pathways.name: Authorization for Disclosure of Protected Health Information
Mail to Fenway Health, 1340 Boylston St, Boston, MA 02215

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patient downloads a generic authorization-for-disclosure PDF, prints and hand-fills it, then submits via fax, email, mail, or MyChart portal.

bright_spots: Companion 3-page FAQ guide explains every form section in plain language
Spanish-language version of the ROI form available
Reproductive health and gender-affirming care shield-law protections included
Granular 10-category sensitive information controls with individual patient initials
Name used (if different) field accommodates patients whose current name differs from legal name
Four submission channels: mail, fax, email, and MyChart portal

findability.rationale: Level 4: Easy to find with basic navigation — a simple web search immediately returned the PDF URL and a dedicated medical records page; no bot-blocking or access barriers.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Usable digitally with workarounds; fax submission available — the born-digital PDF has zero fillable fields, forcing a print-handwrite-scan workflow, but fax, email, and portal submission channels are available.

content_design.rationale: Level 4: Well-organized with minor clarity issues — single-page form with logical 7-section flow and a companion FAQ guide, though the legal notice paragraph is dense and the sensitive-info initials section has a coercive tone.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 3: A patient can use the process but it wasn't designed for them — the FROM/TO structure assumes facility-to-facility transfer, and a patient requesting their own records must figure out how to repurpose the generic authorization form.

compliance.rationale: Level 4: Minor ambiguities but nothing materially impeding — no notarization, no in-person requirement, clear revocation rights, 42 CFR Part 2 cited, but no explicit statement of patient access rights under HIPAA § 164.524 and no fee disclosure.

overall.summary: Fenway Health provides an easy-to-find, well-designed generic ROI form with strong bright spots (FAQ guide, multilingual, sensitive info controls) but lacks a dedicated patient self-access pathway and fillable form fields.
